alert.note: Alert for Northeast Bighorn Mountains; Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 9:29PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Big Horn, southwestern Powder River, southern Rosebud and Sheridan Counties through 1015 PM MDT... At 928 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 20 miles northeast of Ranchester, or 23 miles north of Sheridan, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sheridan, Ranchester, Dayton, Big Horn, Birney, Wyola, Parkman, Tongue River Reservoir, Banner, Moorhead, Birney Village, Otter, Kirby, Rosebud Battlefield Park, Story and Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
